p: Phenolic acids, especially caffeic (CA), ferulic (FA), sinapic (SA), and p‐coumaric acids (PCAs) are present in good quantities in variety of fruits and vegetables (Naczk & Shahidi, 2006). Chlorogenic acid (CGA) is an important hydroxycinnamic acid in food with high AA (Acosta‐Estrada, Gutiérrez‐Uribe, & Serna‐Saldívar, 2014), and its bioavailability depends on absorption and metabolism in human alimentary tract. Gonthier, Verny, Besson, Rémésy, and Scalbert ( 2003) identified the resultant aromatic products ( m‐coumaric acid and derivatives of phenylpropionic and benzoic acids) by gut microbial action on CGA. These resultant metabolites are very important to activity of polyphenols poorly absorbed in the alimentary tract.
